results.title: Making Window Pictures
results.brief_description: In the Brisbane Creative Leisure Centre, conducted by the Cantrills, children are shown reproductions of stained glass windows and then make large transparent pictures with black paper, coloured cellophane, and other materials such as discarded x-ray pictures and textured fabric, with a minimum of instruction. These are taken indoors and fastened to window panes.
results.description: In the Brisbane Creative Leisure Centre, conducted by the Cantrills, children are shown reproductions of stained glass windows and then make large transparent pictures with black paper, coloured cellophane, and other materials such as discarded x-ray pictures and textured fabric, with a minimum of instruction. These are taken indoors and fastened to window panes.

These are taken indoors and fastened to window panes.

results.title: Learning Lucie style
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, ACMI and Elizabeth Creese
results.brief_description: Being born with cerebral palsy has forced Lucie to learn things in different ways to other children. In turn, she has proven to be a great teacher to Elizabeth Creese and her family.

results.title: Exploring...immersive art pedagogy
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, ACMI and Geraldine Burke
results.brief_description: Geraldine Burke’s addiction to daydreaming sometimes got her into trouble but also took her to many wonderful places. Eventually she found the thing that could bring her daydreams to life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, ACMI and Geraldine Burke

results.title: Sunday drives
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, ACMI and Fiona Tinney
results.brief_description: Fiona Tinney delves into the jigsaw of the past, the stories she heard while going on Sunday drives with the family. Even though she was not very interested at the time, these stories, melded with the towns they drove through have imprinted on her memory as Tinney tries to hold on to them.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, ACMI and Fiona Tinney
results.description: Fiona Tinney delves into the jigsaw of the past, the stories she heard while going on Sunday drives with the family. results.title: The Varnished truth
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, ACMI and Elly Temelcos
results.brief_description: Elly Temelcos and her two sisters spent hours over the years listening to her father’s stories, about life in the village, the war that tore his country apart and the sorrow of separation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, ACMI and Elly Temelcos

results.title: Here, there & back again
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Wayne Hornsby and ACMI
results.brief_description: Wayne Hornsby was in Thailand when he was diagnosed with HIV. He reflects on his journey, nearly dying and his return to Australia, where his work in helping HIV positive people eventually leads him back to Thailand.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Wayne Hornsby and ACMI
results.description: Wayne Hornsby was in Thailand when he was diagnosed with HIV. He reflects on his journey, nearly dying and his return to Australia, where his work in helping HIV positive people eventually leads him back to Thailand.

results.title: This is my offering
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Stefanie Christian and ACMI
results.brief_description: Stefanie Christian dedicates her story to the person who supported her throughout her illness, loved her unconditionally and helped her to envisage a bright future full of adventure.

results.title: For my true love
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Russell Varney and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Russell and Wendy were both diagnosed with HIV they resolved to lean on each other as they feared discrimination. Eventually they reached out to organisations like Straight Arrows and started to feel alive again.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Russell Varney and ACMI
results.description: When Russell and Wendy were both diagnosed with HIV they resolved to lean on each other as they feared discrimination. Eventually they reached out to organisations like Straight Arrows and started to feel alive again.
